Could you please check this
Thank you

fields.description:
The  highlighting of repositories in the tree view is now broken. If I double click on a repository, it highlights on the first click and dehighlights on the second click (most of the time - sometimes it remains highlighted blue, rarely it remains highlighted grey).
So now I have the situation where a repository tab view is selected but I can't tell which one because of the elided name, and there is no highlighted repo in the tree view. I have to try to determine the repo I'm in by looking at filenames. Not good.
fields.summary: The tree view highlighting is now broken

fields.description: The text in the repository tab labels is now elided on the right hand side which means when there are multiple repositories starting with the same word it is impossible to tell one repository from another. See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Repository tab eliding

fields.description: See attached picture
fields.summary: Small UI issue in the options

fields.description:
I have sourcetree have my default path for cloning projects to a specific "Projects" folder.

When I am finished reviewing a project, I like to delete the project after I push it into bitbucket, however when I delete it and then select the "Delete Repositories on Disk" option, it deletes files *except* for all the files in the _.git_ folder. This remains and causes the project to not be deleted.

This inherently causes an issue to where I go to clone the project back down at a later time, I have to use a different title because the original (empty) directory already exists
fields.summary: Deleting projects doesn't delete root project folder

fields.description:
Please add the option to set "AutoCRLF" for Git from SourceTree.

Thanks
fields.summary: AutoCRLF

fields.description:
I upgrade to 1.9.5.0 and there are no longer any checkboxes displaying in the staged/unstaged file lists.  There appears to be a gap where a checkbox might be but no checkbox.

It seems I have to select a file then click the 'Stage selected' button.  While this may not seem like a big deal, doubling the clicks I need to make is massively annoying.

In a previous release, the ability to drag and drop between the two panes was removed, now this.  It seems like this part of the UI keeps degrading over the releases.
fields.summary: Checkboxes have gone missing on staged/unstaged file display

fields.description:
After installing sourcetree (windows) version 1.9.5.0 (no other version of sourcetree installed) and I wanted to clone a repository from bitbucket using the clone button in the actions menu from bitbucket using ssh.

This action however did not result in activating sourcetree. The only result was a URL in a browser starting with sourctree://

The workaround we found was this:
- deinstall version 1.9.5.0
- install earlier version
- upgrade to version 1.9.5.0
fields.summary: Impossible to clone a repo from bitbucket

fields.description:
Since 1.9.5.0 you changed the message box styles. That spoils my workflow completly.

An example:
{quote}
It doesn't make sense to use the shortcut SHIFT+CTRL+R for reverting selected modified files when I have to use the mouse to hit the OK Button on the message box!?!?

Even worse: If I hit ENTER the action is cancelled. If I hit ESCAPE the action is cancelled. What button can I hit to avoid using the mouse. That's totally annoying.
{quote}

If you guys are using SourceTree on you own you certainly have recognize this!
See attachements for some place where must change your message boxes to satisfy power users.
fields.summary: Wrong button focus or missing keyboard shotcut on the most frequent message boxes

fields.description: The recent commit message list isn't updated after I committed. But it is only after switching to "Log/History" tab or any other view and than back to File Status.
fields.summary: Recent commit message list isn't updated after commit

fields.description: You have a release branch running, you click the 'GitFlow' button, and then 'Finish Release' button you are presented with an error (attached)
fields.summary: Git Flow Finish Release Error

fields.description:
Commit message for merge conflict is not shown when I face merge conflict.
First time I met this situation I thought it is part of modification of the version.
But when I got back to File Status tab after I went to Log / History tab, the message I expected was there in the message place.
fields.summary: Commit message for merge conflict is not shown automatically.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a folder without any name (whitespace or nothing)
2. (optional) Move repository entries into the folder or don't
3. Try to move the folder to the any of the levels at the top.

The folder gets consumed into nowhere independent from the content it's holding.
fields.summary: Buggy behavior trying to move nameless folder

fields.description:
If you do not have a SSH key when updating to 1.9.5 the Load SSH dialog will appear and it will say "Click No to create later" when it is a yes, cancel dialog:

!image-2016-07-22-15-23-47-776.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Customer's report: Wrong use of terms in "Load SSH Key" popup window

fields.description:
Switching branches - fails to update UI
Endless loading when opening/switching repo

Have to close and reopen to 'hopefully get things to reset each time

crashes

When I updated about 4 days ago there were about 5-6 minor updates that were skipped over.

Whatever you have done in this release, makes it unusable on windows - I have mac version also which is just fine. And if I switch to cmd line all git status/activity is just fine. It is the Sourcetree UI that is bluntly screwed in this release.

You did good several months back, but it is now worse than it ever was before.

You have a week, otherwise I need myself and my team using something different along with command line.

Good luck!
fields.summary: version 1.9.50 - unusable

fields.description: Presumably as a result of SRCTREEWIN-4477, it is now next to impossible to use SourceTree along with command-line Git because SourceTree scans directory changes almost constantly, locking Git's internal structures. Version 1.8.3 only re-scanned the tree while SourceTree had focus and did nothing otherwise, freeing up internal structures for non-SourceTree tasks. This issue pretty much prevents interactive rebasing from command-line. It is imperative that there is an option to only reload the tree if the application has focus. I have returned to 1.8.3 for now.
fields.summary: v1.9.5 blocking issue with tree reloading

fields.description: To replicate this issue, create 3 folders with a few bookmarks in each folder. Expand the top folder and collapse the other folders. Try to drag a repository from the top folder to the bottom folder. As the cursor passes over the middle folder it will expand, making the bottom folder harder to reach. This is even worse if you have 5 folders, and one of them has 20 repositories in it.
fields.summary: Dragging bookmarks over folders expands the folder, making the destination folder difficult to reach

fields.description:
top toolbar miss half the labels... 
staging does not refresh the UI...

fields.summary: The drag'n'drop of letters from the grid to the tree is not supported

fields.description:
Every single time I commit, SourceTree crashes.  

The workaround mentioned in SRCTREEWIN-2324 does allow me to commit by switching to the File Status tab after I have staged the files I want to commit, but that's a pain.

I've included the sourcetree.log file, but it doesn't contain any useful information; no entries from the last two days at all.
fields.summary: Commit causes crash from Log/History view

fields.description: Previous released version of Source Tree allowed the user to highlight one or more files in the File Status or Log/History view and use Ctrl C to copy the Path and File Names listed in the File Status or Log/History view and then paste them either in the commit message or a third party application (notepad, et cetera).
fields.summary: Ctrl C No Longer Copies File Path and Name in File Status or Log/History View

fields.description:
New versions of Git have the AVH Git Flow version. 

The biggest issue is that the Source Tree version merges release branches in different way:
The Git (AVH) Git Flow merges release into master branch, tags it, and then merges master into develop. 
The SourceTree merges release into both master and develop branches, making version tag unreachable from develop branch. 

This makes the Source Tree Git Flow version *incompatible*. 

There are at least 3 other issues on this problem: 
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-1762 
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-1394 
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-2052
fields.summary: Git Flow incompatible with the one embedded in GIT.

fields.description:
After doing a PULL on a branch the commit message appears blank. Normally the message is filled with: 
Merge branch 'feature/NAME' of https://url into feature/NAME

Work around:
When switching between File Status and Log / History, and back to File Status the commit message is filled again.
fields.summary: Commit message empty after pull

fields.description: After upgrade to version 1.9.5.0 some labels for buttons in menu are missing. See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Labels for some buttons in menu are not visible

fields.description: I had several time a 20-30s second freeze of the UI when either clicking on the commit button or when selecting a different repo through a "tab" control.
fields.summary: SourceTree UI freezes sometimes

fields.description:
In some recent version, the default button on some confirmation dialogs (e.g. discard changes, delete untracked file) changed from "OK" to "Cancel". Looking through the release notes, I guess the likely culprit is "SRCTREE-149 Implemented new generic notification dialog", as the appearance of the dialogs have also changed.

The change just means there's an extra hoop to jump through when doing any action that throws a confirmation. For example, I used to be able to highlight unstaged files to revert and hit ctrl+shift+r then enter. Now I either need to go for the mouse or tab a few times to reach the OK button. This is a fairly common use case.

Ideally I would like the option to turn off the confirmation dialogs completely, but barring this please change the default back to OK.
fields.summary: Default button on confirmation dialogs should be OK

fields.description:
When selecting multiple files and selecting the Stop Tracking from Context Menu, you get a dialog for confirmation about if you wish to stop tracking those files. 

The buttons are reversed, as the cancel is OK and OK is Cancel.
fields.summary: Stop Tracking cancel and OK button functions are reversed

Thanks!

The title bar is off the top of the screen, and the "OK" button is halfway under my taskbar. There is no scroll bar, though there are more options than can be displayed on the screen: only the top half of the text "After committing, stay in commit dialog if there are still pending changes" is visible.

OS Name	Microsoft Windows 10 Home
Version	10.0.10586 Build 10586

config: tool--default text encoding is utf-8.

See git log messages : encoding is utf-8, so Chinese display correctly.

But our project source file useing GBK, so when I see diffs :

 !image-2016-07-21-10-55-54-722.png|thumbnail! 

Can be divided into two configurations, so more flexible?

Thanks!

source Tree 非常棒！！！

fields.description:
Reproduction steps:

1. Make changes to multiple files (2-4 is enough)
2. Stage files
3. Create stash
4. Click to display stash preview

Expected: 

A collection of diffs is displayed up to some performance limit detailing the changes in the stash.

Actual:

Only the first file is shown.

--- 

Please see the following `git stash show` output:

https://i.imgur.com/oMfJWqF.png (Attachment Atlassian.Bug-01.01.png)

Note the stash has changes to 4 files, and the corresponding preview in sourcetree:

https://i.imgur.com/3IUPM3H.png (Attachment Atlassian.Bug-01.02.png)

Note only the one diff is visible, it's hard to ascertain what you'd be importing if you apply a stash without being able to see a number of the pending changes.
fields.summary: Stash Preview only shows a single file

fields.description: It seems like there is a test menu *Notification-Test* being left in the production build of SourceTree. When clicking this option, some sample popups come up.
fields.summary: Test menu left in production build

fields.description:
I'd like to quickly run a custom action with a single click, like a script that just calls "git rebase dev" to rebase my work on the latest dev branch.

Initially, the custom actions menu item is just a menu item and clicking it does absolutely nothing.  It looks and feels broken.

At the very least, it should have a sub menu item like "edit custom actions"; otherwise, I think the button is broken and don't even realize I have to go into "Settings" to set up custom actions.

Custom actions are useful, but hard to reach in a menu.  It would be nice if we could create a button for them on the main button panel at the top of source tree so we can reach a custom action with one click.
fields.summary: Allow adding "custom action" buttons on the main tool panel, and add "edit custom actions" to the custom actions menu

fields.description:
Under some circumstances, when creating a branch from specified commit, the Pick Commit window will show the diff between current branch and selected commit the new branch should be created from. The result is that the branch is created from the current working copy instead of the specified commit.

It seems to be related to how far down you scroll in the Pick Commit window. I can only reproduce it if I pick the first commit in the repository.

*Work Around*
Before scrolling in the Pick Commit dialog select any row other than the current working copy.
This resets the row selection and from that point on the dialog should respect the single row selection rule.
fields.summary: Branch is created from the wrong specified commit

fields.description: Currently _sourcetree_ shows *stashed* files as Diff. But sometimes I just want to see which files are stashed, not the code change. With a list of files I can see them without having to scroll all the way down through the Diff stuff.
fields.summary: An option to see stashed files as a list of files

fields.description:
Was working on the new stage/unstage area.  Need double-click to stage a file, making me click 'Stage Selected' is not ideal.

But when I staged a few files and then wanted to unstage them I clicked 'Unstage All' and nothing happened.  I selected each file individually and 'Unstage selected' did the right thing.  

Drag and drop could also be good here but double click and space bar functionality would be ideal.
fields.summary: Staging Files:  Unstage All does not work

fields.description: In previous versions, every now and then ST would incorrectly claim that index.lock existed. Now I'm getting it pretty much every time I switch branch - the only solution seems to be restarting ST, at which point it's quite happy to switch branch.
fields.summary: Frequent "index.lock exists" message when it doesn't

fields.description:
Thanks for the great app!

I updated to latest version of SourceTree v1.9.5.0. I'm using Windows 10 64bit.

Update was successful but window appeared saying something like "cannot find Git for windows" with options to "scan again", "browse for file", "download" etc.

Selected Browse for file and nothing happened to the UI - i.e. source tree application was no longer open.

Computer slowed down considerably (8GB of Ram), Task manager reported a new Git For Windows process opening every second or so in an endless loop.

Tried killing the SourceTree process, restarting computer, opening ST again caused the same issue.

Tried uninstalling SourceTree and reinstalling 1.9.5.0 but the same issue reappeared to the point of crashing the machine.

Eventually reverted to an older stable version 1.6.25.0
fields.summary: Updating version unsets git - scanning for git on windows creates endless Git for Windows process loop

fields.description: My SourceTree for Windows just updated this morning and every time it starts I'm getting the attached error message now.
fields.summary: Mercurial is older

fields.description:

When pressing SpaceBar focus should remain into same view to allow other files to select by keyboard without need to use mouse.

fields.description:
A number of BugSplat crashes have been reported, usually to do with SourceTree crashing when launching or opening a mercurial repository.

*Cause*
 This crash is caused when SourceTree detects that there is no default Username set for a repo, this is the user details typically shown above the commit message textbox.

If there is no username defined SourceTree will try and open a dialog to ask the user to set the name and email address of the user. This is being triggered at a time when the dialog cannot be opened and causes the crash.

A fix is in progress.

*Work Around*
 Ensure that any .hgrc or mercurial.ini files found in
* bookmarked repository's .hg folder
* %HOME% folder
* %USERPROFILE% folder

contain section like this. 

{code}
[ui]
username=Joe Blogs <joe.blogs@example.com>
{code}



Alternatively temporarily moving the %localappdata%\Atlassian\SourceTree\bookmarks.xml out of the %localappdata%\Atlassian\SourceTree folder, opening SourceTree and then editing the user name and email in the Tools/Options/General Tab will write the details to the %USERPROFILE%\.hgrc file.

It should then be possible to replace the bookmarks.xml and restart SourceTree.
fields.summary: Crash for Mercurial Repositories when .hgrc or mecurial.ini do not contain a username

fields.description:
I was receiving an error regarding git lock file exists each time I pulled down in SourceTree, so I restarted SourceTree, now every subsequent Pull is returning "Authenticate" popup, and it not progressing with correct password. 

This happened one other time, and after many retries it finally accepted the password. Appears to relate to issue SRCTREEWIN-3957.

 !image-2016-07-20-10-15-24-052.png|thumbnail! 

Please advise, maybe server maintenance was occurring at this time. But I am currently blocked.

Thanks

*UPDATE - FOUND BUG*
On further investigation, see screenshot-1, it appears Xamarin or Visual Studio were locking the two folders in question which I believe caused the Authenticate popup to appear incorrectly. It seems if SourceTree detects a "permission denied" error (which is thrown by explorer) it determines it to be an authentication error.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Sudden authentication error blocking Pull operation
Default button in confirmation dialog boxes should be "Yes"

In all honesty this is minor, but without a solid reason (IMO it doesn't look any better or clearer) that's space that I'd really rather not lose.

It does not hurt anything, but does affect my view of the tool negatively (what else is in here...). If it is meant to be in the release, can the strings used in the notifications be user visible strings instead of basic strings with numbers concatenated?

fields.description:
SourceTree has been changing his colors on last versión, some colors are default windows colors and some others are fixed/static colors, this is a problem for people using their own windows color scheme like "High contrast mode".
 !image-2016-07-19-08-42-39-740.png|thumbnail! 

What to do?
please,
- if you set a black color for a text, then let it as windows default (it's already black by default)
- if you set a static color for a text, then set a static color for his background.
- if you set a static color for a background, then set a static color for his text.

Thank you so much.
fields.summary: Wrong interface for high contrast windows

fields.description: The checkbox on each item when staging / unstaging files appears to have been removed. This was an extremely useful feature, and it would be great to see it put back in. If someone felt it was unintuitive, you could at least have changed it to a "stage" button on each item. Having to individually select each item and click "Stage" is terrible compared to the old way.

Additionally - if you have a single file. Right click it and 'Add', and then in the staged files area press 'unstage selected'. The file moves back down to unstaged files - but the 'stage selected' button remains greyed out and unclickable. See second screenshot

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

fields.description: After upgrade to this version I can't start the application.

fields.description:
With 1.9.5.0 clicking on a commit no longer auto-selects the first file that changed in this commit to show up in the diff-view on the right side. This is a huge step back since you now have to click twice instead of once for one-file commits.

Also there does not appear to be a way of supporting (loot) this project. You should add a possibility to the site

fields.description:
After doing a fetch I got the indication that I needed to do a pull on my current branch (Pull needed 1.png). I checked out my demo branch and the Pull button still indicate that I am behind (Pull needed 2.png). Switching back to the first branch, that is behind, now the Pull button do not indicate that a pull is needed (Pull needed 3.png). Notice that the bookmark indicator also is having this issue, but the indicator on the branch itself is correct.

The next time SourceTree syncs against Bitbucket, the indicator on the Pull button corrects itself, but if you switch branch again it gets out of sync again.
fields.summary: Pull notification showing wrong information when switching between branches

fields.description: When about to insert commit message (click on text field) the application crashes.
fields.summary: Crash at commit message

fields.description:
Questionable different branch network presentation in modes "All Branches"/  "Current Branch". When viewing the commit graph (ordered by date) in mode "All Branches" it looks like the branch "hotfix/VFY-47" (see attached screen on the left) never was merged into develop and master (but it was!). Changing the viewmode to "Current Branch" (see attached screen on the right) the presentation is correct. 

Changing "order by date" to "order by ancestors" (? in german its called "Nach Vorfahren ordnen") the representation is correct in both modes.
fields.summary: Questionable different presentation of graphs between modes  "All branches" and "Current Branch" (order by date)

fields.description: When I try to commit one or more files I get an "oops" pop-up/
fields.summary: Crash attempting to commit

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

#1 Set your files to be sorted by filename - by clicking the filename header once
#2 Set your files to be sorted by status - by clicking the status column header once
- Your modified files will appear last 

#3 Now click the status column header again to make the modified files to appear first (instead of last) - unfortunately modified files still appear last.
- *This is where the issue lies.*

Workaround:
Stage/Unstage any file (clicking the checkbox next to any file) will cause the modified files to finally appear first.
fields.summary: Sort unstaged files by status through clicking the status header will not work the second time.

fields.description:
Customer's report:

{quote}Twice now, I've run into this issue: After an improper windows shutdown (once a blue-screen, once just a cold-restart after windows didn't wake up correctly from sleep), I observed SourceTree crash consistently on startup. Today I spent a bit of time trying to find a work around, and was successful.

It appeared that my user.config file was corrupted (contained all nulls, rather than valid XML). I forget the exact exception, but essentially it's throwing an unhanded exception trying to parse the XML ('Root element is missing' was the additional information embedded in this exception). My work around was to just remove my user.config file and let SourceTree create a new one.

This should be a very easy scenario for you guys to detect and fix though, on your end.{quote}
fields.summary: Customer's report: Corrupted user.config after every improper windows shutdown

fields.description:
In certain cases, SourceTree constantly asks for git credentials, even after they have ben entered correctly.  Investigations are needed to see if the cause is:
- Bug in the SourceTree source code.
- GIT_ASKPASS environment variable.
- git-credential-winstore.exe can't access the passwords stored by SourceTree.

Drilling down, it seems that entries in the store are also disappearing as trusted combinations.
fields.summary: Git actions repeatedly ask for credentials.

fields.description:
using the handy "Jump to:" feature when searching for a specific commit seems to not find the commit if the shortened hash does not fit the style shown in the log / history window.

for example, if I am searching for commit 4197a6d the following searches do not work:
04197A6D (fails)
4197A6D (fails)

I am only able to find the commit if the commit searched is all lower case with no preceding zero.

4197a6d (works)
fields.summary: Jump to: Commit does not appear to find the commit if the hash contains uppercase characters or extra zeros at the beginning

fields.description: When i make a commit and sourcetree detects a change from one of my submodules, I am prompted to open or skip it. When i click the open button, sourcetree crashes.
fields.summary: Crash when committing and moving to a changed submodule

fields.description: I would like to be able to select lines from the diff viewer and cherry-pick those lines as in git cherry-pick -p. If the currently selected commit is an ancestor of the head, show the *reverse lines* button. Otherwise, show a *cherry pick lines* button.
fields.summary: Cherry Pick lines

fields.description: Pull repo from Bitbucket.org.  Click yes to accept server key.  CRASH.  Every time.  Rebooted, problem still occurs.  I can pull from our in-house Bitbucket server without issue.
fields.summary: Crashes when accepting Bitbucket.org key

fields.description:
Hello,
i have a problem when i pushed commit. The sourcetree do a abnormal system end, when i pushed "commit". 
It happend also, when i delete the local project and clone the exist repository.
Can you help me
fields.summary: abnormal system end by commit

fields.description:
Often, SourceTree gets into a weird state whereby none of my modified files are shown. In other words, going to *File Status* tab and refreshing doesn't show anything, despite command line {{git status}} clearly showing something was changed.

I then try to get the *Uncommitted Changes* commit in the *Log / History* tab to refresh.. and when I refresh that view, it blocks in the *Loading...* state forever:

!SourceTree-Win-Load-Forever.png!

The repositories this happens on are both big and small. It happens a lot, usually when I have several repo tabs open. However, lately I've been working on a smaller repository (113 files over 32 folders taking ~4.5MB of diskspace). So I'm thinking there is a more critical problem here.

And once SourceTree is in this state, the other opened tabs behave the same way; ditto on even opening a new repository tab (so opening/closing the tab won't work).

This happens frequently and the only fix it to close/restart SourceTree.. and then do the same again later when it gets into the same state.
fields.summary: Log/History view blocks Loading forever

fields.description:
Currently Clone/New defaults to 'C:\Users\xxxxxx\Documents\'.

I store my repositories elsewhere to keep Documents clean.

I have looked in settings and cannot find a setting to change this default. It would a nice to have.
fields.summary: Set default directory for Clone/New

fields.description:
I was on the default branch and up to date.
I had made some changes locally - not commited.
I created a branch with some changes staged and some not.
Crash.
fields.summary: Creating branch while having local changes = crash

fields.description:
Currently the commit text links are not working. Please see screenshot, I defined two regular expressions (which work that way in 1.8.3).

Both of them are recognized but the first one is opened without replacement, the second one doesn't open a browser window at all
fields.summary: Commit text links not working

fields.description:
SourceTree Version 1.8.3 installs a 7za.exe (C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\tools\7za.exe) in Version 9.20, which has known vulnerabilities:
CVE-2016-2334
CVE-2016-2335

More information about the vulnerabilities: http://blog.talosintel.com/2016/05/multiple-7-zip-vulnerabilities.html
fields.summary: SourceTree 7za Vulnerability.

fields.description: I deeply desire SourceTree to have a view like Plastic SCM's Branch Explorer.  Seeing the branches in 2D space makes me happy and comfortable because it mimics reality. Similarly to mimicking reality, Plastic SCM's graph actually changes when you branch something. The SourceTree graph seems to flatten and eliminate all indication of actual branching except for eventual specific conditions. I'm sure this is efficient and brilliant use of space, but it ultimately makes SourceTree less intuitive for me to use. A quick google search shows I'm not alone in the confusion.
fields.summary: Branch Explorer similar to Plastic SCM

fields.description: Please add branch name to commit info: http://prntscr.com/bsend5
fields.summary: Add branch name to commit description

fields.description:
When using interactive rebase to squash > 3 commits, SourceTree seems to think it has done it correctly, but looking at the commits afterwards it is clear it has only managed to squash some of the commits.

# Create a new Git repository containing an empty text file
# Create several (I used 5) commits, each adding text to the text file
# Right click the very first commit and choose "Rebase children..."
# Select the commit at the top and repeatedly press "Squash with previous" at the bottom until only one commit is left
# Select "OK"

Expected behaviour: We are left with two commits: the first commit of an empty file, and a second commit which contains all the changes made in the first 5 commits.

Actual: I get 4 commits: The first of an empty file, the next two commits as they were before the rebase, and a 4th commit which contains the rest of the changes, squashed.

I first experienced this with > 10 commits and each time it seemed to only squash 3 commits. I am able to work around this repeatedly entering the rebase screen or using command line.
fields.summary: Only 3 or fewer commits can be squashed at once

fields.description: Currently the default button in dialoag messages is the "cancel" button. Here it is really hard to work with the keyboard to confirm the action. Please mark the "do action" button by default or add an option in the settings to prevent such dialogs.
fields.summary: Keyboard support in confirmation dialog
